source:
<class name="PointVectorValuePair" extends="Pair" startLine="24">
* This class holds a point and the vectorial value of an objective function at * that point. PointValuePair org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateVectorFunction $Id: PointVectorValuePair.java 1422230 2012-12-15 12:11:13Z erans $ As of 3.1 (to be removed in 4.0). 3.0
* Serializable UID.
* Builds a point/objective function value pair. point Point coordinates. This instance will store * a copy of the array, not the array passed as argument. value Value of the objective function at the point.
* Build a point/objective function value pair. point Point coordinates. value Value of the objective function at the point. copyArray if {@code true}, the input arrays will be copied, * otherwise they will be referenced.
* Gets the point. a copy of the stored point.
* Gets a reference to the point. a reference to the internal array storing the point.
* Gets the value of the objective function. a copy of the stored value of the objective function.
* Gets a reference to the value of the objective function. a reference to the internal array storing the value of * the objective function.
* Replace the instance with a data transfer object for serialization. data transfer object that will be serialized
* Internal class used only for serialization.
* Serializable UID.
* Point coordinates.
* Value of the objective function at the point.
* Simple constructor. point Point coordinates. value Value of the objective function at the point.
* Replace the deserialized data transfer object with a {@link PointValuePair}. replacement {@link PointValuePair}
